title: Wyoming Town Recovers From New Year's Fire
teaser: A raging fire swept through historic buildings in Dubois, a picturesque tourist stop on the way to Yellowstone.
contentencoded:
The town that calls itself an authentic western town “where real cowboys work and play” is trying to recover from a New Year’s fire that destroyed several businesses. Dubois, Wyoming, is a tourist stop on the way to Yellowstone.

Dubois mayor Twila BlakemanÂ tells Here & Now’s Peter O’Dowd that Dubois’ tourism economy will bounce back and “we will be able to handle everybody that comes to Dubois” for winter snowmobiling and summer camping.

Guest

  • Twila Blakeman, mayor of Dubois, Wyoming.

Related

  • Dubois fire chief calls help with downtown blaze 'a blessing'
